tags: Wait time,
review: *** ** **** **** she calm. but when anything major issue she won't tell properly. bcz I gone through. my  child body was too hot frm 1week and I been der clinic thrice I was getting ans frm her was he is f9 dats all.. but I was nt happy with her ans bcz my child  body was hot and he was nt normal  I thought something was wrong. so I consulted other doc *** * *** ** **** ** *** ***** ********** *** ** *** ** ** **** *** *** **** *** * *** *** *** ** *** **** **  ******* ******** I am really disappoint.i am nt at all satisfied. *** ***** **** **** **** ********* ** ** **** **** I was so worried  his  body was too hot and she is telling nothing he f9. really plz think twice thrice before u r going a hospital
reply_text:
Thank you for the feedback. We hope that your baby has recovered. We have looked into your record and it looks like you had brought the baby for loose stools at the end of February, then you had come with history of baby being warm and then last week you had brought the baby for cough and fever. Everytime when the temperature was checked in the clinic it was low grade or there was no fever. If you had mentioned that he had high fever for one week, we would have definitely evaluated further. The reason we waited was because he  had low grade fever and mild respiratory symptoms and he was active and you didn't have to give paracetamol to control fever , if I remember right. Moreover, if any concern goes on for more than a week we always evaluate with lab tests as needed and in your case also we would have done the same. We don't misuse resources or don't make patients spend unnecessarily by doing tests early on when there is no indication. It's a reasonable choice to wait and observe for a week when there is low grade fever or minimal clinical symptoms.

If you don't trust us you are welcome to go elsewhere. But, please remember you are NOT  qualified to comment on the ability of the doctor when you don't have the clinical expertise.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I and my husband have always banked on Dr Anjana's treatment when it comes to our son's health.
She gives enough time to listen to the problem, makes my son feel comfortable, explains us the cause and treatment in detail, doesn't prescribe unnecessary medicines, and her treatment has worked well for my son every time. She is quick to respond during emergencies too, which is a big plus for us as working parents.
Though we live quite far from the clinic, we visit her clinic for any issues with my son's health and are very happy with her treatment so far.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We knew something was wrong with our baby's stomach but didn't know the reason why our baby was crying/behaving crazy all night. We went to Dr Anjana Hulse and found out it was due to colic issue in his stomach which was upsetting him. So she gave a medicine (colic aid drops) which immediately gave results. It's like magic! 
Amazing experience. We had visited our regular paediatric doc earlier at fortis but it didn't result any good for the baby. I think from now on we will continue with the newly found paediatric Dr Anjana Hulse. 
Thanks again doc.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr Anjana was referred to us by our pediatrician. Our son's condition had us very worried and we were very apprehensive before visiting her. She briefed us about the condition and its causes and lines of treatment. She put us at ease and was well informed and able to address our concerns. We would definitely recommend her to our friends or colleagues. A very positive experience and we left feeling very assured and satisfied. Given the need for followups, we would be seeing her often and her nature and demeanor give us confidence to entrust our child's health in her hands.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: *** ****** ***** ** *** ** *** **** ************ *** ********** *************** ** ********** *** ** **** ************* *** is very patient and listens to all our queries, concerns and explains each and everything. She gives ample time to every patient and never rushes. And does thorough checkup, does not prescribe unnecessary medicines. Also she is cordial enough to pick the phone if we call in case of emergency. This is my experience with Dr.Anjana Hulse. I would always recommend her to other parents.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
context: Bone age Xrays interpreted accurately,Growth & Development Evaluation / Management,Nutritional,
review: Dr pays attention to details and examines the patient thoroughly. Also, explained the health condition and did not leave us in doubt. This is what matters the most to me. So its worth the wait time. Also, the suggested tests were apt. Most importantly, Dr was friendly with the patient (my daughter). My daughter was happy to go for the second consultation as well after a few days.Overall we're satisfied with the treatment. Thank you!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My son had high fever , loose motions and cold kept us up all night. We were worried. Went to Dr Anjana at the earliest appointment available. She took time to patiently hear us out on the health history, made the kid feel very comfortable, priscribed mandatory course as well as ones 'just in case'.  He responded well to the medicine and recovered with in two days.
Also, the excellent aesthetics of clinic is a plus.

tags: None
review: Dr. Anjana is very friendly. She listens to all our problems and suggests the remedies accordingly. Took my 9 month old since he has some cold, caugh and constipation. She prescribed very few medicines and suggested to adjust the diet. Very practical approach treating kids. We are impressed with her treatment and surely suggest her to my friends and family.
